verses.text:
Infinite Love! what precious stores
Thy mercy has opened for us!
The costliest gems, the richest ores,
Could never have endowed us thus.

But thy soft hand, O gracious Lord,
Can draw from poverty the spring;
And thy rich bounty to our board
Can bread for hungering sinners bring.

How rich the grace! the gift how free!
'Tis only 'ask,'â€”it shall be given;
'Tis only 'knock,' and thou shalt see
The open door that leads to heaven.

O then arise, and take the good,
So full and freely proffered thee,
Remembering that it cost the blood
Of Him who died on Calvary.
